BackstoryDef.title: demolitions showman
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] neutralized IEDs for a frontier bomb disposal unit, until pirates conscripted [PAWN_objective] to breach rival compounds. Now [PAWN_pronoun] compulsively rigs defensive positions with improvised munitions, muttering about "artistic detonations".

BackstoryDef.title: planetbreaker
BackstoryDef.description: [PAWN_nameDef] wasn’t conscripted—[PAWN_pronoun] was absorbed. [PAWN_possessive] former home had already been flagged for acquisition when the Planetbreaker Syndicate arrived. Their message was simple: surrender or be scrubbed. Most complied. [PAWN_pronoun] didn’t have a choice. \nTrained in orbit, [PAWN_pronoun] became one of thousands: drop troopers tasked with planetary subjugation. They hit frontier worlds, flattened resistance, and flagged what remained for auction or scrapping. \n[PAWN_pronoun] lasted longer than most. Long enough to stop asking who the enemy was. But when a failed cleansing op stranded [PAWN_possessive] squad on an unsellable rimworld, command cut losses and filed them MIA. The syndicate didn’t tolerate sunk costs.

BackstoryDef.title: static eater
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] ran with the Static-Eaters, a nomadic pirate gang steeped in cultist overtones, known for stripping tech from derelicts and corpses alike. Their rites fused machine worship and cannibalism into a single creed, chasing ever more deranged methods of improvised augmentation. \nImperial intelligence suspects a deeper hand behind the clique. Pirates aren’t supposed to know this much about anatomy or implants — not without help. With every strike, the truth turns murkier.

BackstoryDef.title: powder ganger
BackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was the “lucky” winner of a twisted lottery held after the Powder Gangers took over a quiet settlement. The prize? Forced enlistment. While the others were executed or enslaved, [PAWN_pronoun] was handed a gun and a choice that wasn’t really a choice. \nGleeful and half-mad, [PAWN_pronoun] claimed to be the lucky one while the rest burned. [PAWN_nameDef] picked up shooting fast—too fast—but never learned how to hold their own up close. \nPoint and pull was all [PAWN_pronoun] needed.
